Title: Beef Stew in Red Wine Sauce
Summary: This cozy dish, reminiscent of beef bourguignon, was a specialty of Jacques Pépin's mother.
Description: Jeannette Pépin, Jacques Pépin's mother, served this red wine–beef stew at her Lyon restaurant, Le Pélican, where she would cook tougher cuts of meat into a rich, luscious, comforting dish. The recipe doesn't use stock, demi-glace, or even water, relying on robust red wine to create the deeply flavored braising sauce. The finished dish is a celebration of cozy, comforting French fare — and always a hit with Pépin's chef friends.
